page.title: 14HARGRAVE CHURCH
page.content: The church in Hargrave is Norman but there was a wooden Saxon church before the present church was built. The church, which is Church of England, has a tall spire. An old rector gave the church an organ as a goodbye gift. In the church there are some very old wall paintings of a man in a red cloak. The church also has a stained-glass window over the altar and some old Roman bones in a stone coffin. The present rector is The Reverend Eagle, who is also rector of Stanwick. On the first Sunday in every month, a children's service is held. Special services are held at Easter, Whitsun and Christmas. Some time during the Summer a flower festival is staged and in the Autumn there is a harvest festival.
